title: Chipotle Braised Pork
description: Pork shoulder braised with chipotle. Dirt cheap, dead simple, surprisingly complex. Great for bulk prep — tacos, bowls, whatever.

items.note: minimize — meat peeks an inch over the liquid

items.item: salt, black pepper, cumin, Mexican oregano, mustard powder, cocoa powder

items.note: juiced and zested — can sub vinegar, just needs acid

directions.title: Prep
directions.text: Cube pork, salt generously, dry brine if you have time. The sear is the most important step though — you can handle salting later if needed.

directions.title: Sear
directions.text: Sear pork in small batches until well browned. Take care not to scorch the bottom of the pot — you don't want burnt flavors.

directions.title: Tomato Paste
directions.text: Add tomato paste, cook the funk off.

directions.title: Braise
directions.text: Deglaze with stock. Add chipotles, seared pork, and all spices. Minimize liquid — you don't want it wet.

directions.title: Pressure Cook
directions.text: Pressure cook 90 minutes at high (~11 psi). Natural release — no "keep warm," don't touch the vent.

directions.title: Finish
directions.text: Add lime juice and zest. Consider frying it up when it's done.

notes: Cubed because you don't want muscle fibers to be weirdly long. Imagine long pulled pork — gross.
If you don't make your own stock or can't get gelatinous stock from the refrigerated section, just use white wine.
